holidays.name: National Lager Day
holidays.description: A day to raise a cold glass to lagers ‚Äî those crisp, refreshing beers that keep holiday parties lively!
holidays.origin: Celebrated mostly in the U.S., this unofficial day is all about appreciating the versatility and smooth taste of lager beer varieties.
holidays.funFact: Lager requires cold fermentation, which was only possible to do reliably after refrigeration was invented.

holidays.name: Human Rights Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights by the United Nations General Assembly in 1948.
holidays.origin: Established by the UN to promote global human rights awareness and encourage action worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The Universal Declaration has inspired more than 60 human rights instruments that together constitute an international standard of human rights.

holidays.name: Wear Brown Shoes Day
holidays.description: A humorous fashion reminder to retire your brown shoes for winter ‚Äî since December is the last month to sport them before switching to boots!
holidays.origin: An unofficial fashion quip among style enthusiasts noting that brown shoes are considered a warm-season staple.
holidays.funFact: Traditionally, brown shoes are less formal than black shoes and are often associated with spring and summer wardrobes.

holidays.name: Nobel Prize Day
holidays.description: Honors the anniversary of Alfred Nobel's death and celebrates the announcement of Nobel Prize laureates for outstanding contributions in Physics, Chemistry, Medicine, Literature, Peace, and Economics.
holidays.origin: The prize ceremonies are held annually on December 10th in Stockholm and Oslo, established by Nobel's will in 1895.
holidays.funFact: The Nobel Peace Prize is actually awarded in Oslo, Norway, rather than Stockholm where the other prizes are presented.
